Overload.descr:
ABS( number )
Returns the absolute value of a number.

ANCESTORS([ reference ])
Used within another function to reference all of the ancestors in a cell's hierarchy

AND( logical_expression1 , [ logical_expression2, ... ])
Used within another function to return true if all provided logical expressions are true.

AVERAGEIF( range , criterion , [ average_range ])
Returns the average of a range of numbers that meet a given criteria

AVG( number1 , [ number2, ... ])
Returns the average (mean) of the provided numbers.

AVGW( range , range_weight )
Returns a weighted average (the mean, where each value is weighted by its relative importance)

CEILING( number , [ multiple ])
Rounds a number away from zero to the nearest specified multiple of significance

CHAR( number )
Converts a number into a character

CHILDREN([ reference ])
Used within another function to reference the child rows of the referenced parent row.

COLLECT( range , criterion_range1 , criterion1 , [ criterion_range2, criterion2, ... ])
Used within another function to collect specific values in a range that meet the provided criteria.

CONTAINS( search_for , range )
Is used within another function to search for a character or string. It will return "True" if it found the character or string. Otherwise, it will return "False."

COUNT( value1 , [ value2, ... ])
Counts nonblank values

COUNTIF( range , criterion )
Counts the number of cells within a range that meet a criterion.

COUNTIFS( range1 , criterion1 , [ range2, criterion2, ... ])
Counts the number of times all given conditions in their respective ranges are met.

COUNTM( search_range1 , [search_range2, ... ])
Counts the number of elements in a multicontact or multiselect dropdown column cell or cell range. When you use this function, it returns the total number of elements it finds.

DATE( year , month , day )
Combines values for a year, month, and day into a date

DATEONLY( date_time )
Use this function in a Date column to extract the date portion of a date/time value.

DAY( date )
Returns a number representing the day of the month, 1-31, where 1 is the first day

DECTOHEX( number )
Converts a decimal number into a hexadecimal value.

DESCENDANTS([ parent_cell ])
Is used within another function to reference all descendant rows of the parent row's referenced cell.

DISTINCT( range )
Used within another function to return an array of unique values in a range.

FIND( search_for , text_to_search , [ start_position ])
Use this function to return the starting position of a string within text.

FLOOR( number , [ multiple ])
Rounds a number toward zero to the nearest specified multiple of significance

HAS( search_range , criterion )
Searches for an exact match of a single value, including if this value appears in a multicontact or multiselect dropdown column cells or ranges with other values. If HAS finds the exact match, it returns "True." Otherwise, it returns "False."

HEXTODEC( hex_string )
Converts a hexadecimal value to decimal number

IF( logical_expression , value_if_true , [ value_if_false ])
Evaluates a logical expression and returns one value when true or another when false.

IFERROR( value , value_if_error )
Returns the first value if it isn't an error and otherwise returns the second value

INDEX( range , row_index , [ column_index ])
Returns an item from a collection based on provided row and column indexes

INT( value )
Returns the integer portion of a number

ISBLANK( value )
Checks whether a value is blank

ISBOOLEAN( value )
Checks whether a value is a boolean (e.g., checkbox, flag, or star)

ISCRITICAL( value )
Identifies if a row is on the critical path.

ISDATE( value )
Checks whether a value is a date

ISERROR( value )
Checks for a calculation error within another formula

ISEVEN( value )
Checks whether a number is even. If a value is even, this function returns "True." If the value is odd, this function returns "False."

ISNUMBER( value )
Checks whether a value is a number

ISODD( value )
Checks whether a number is odd. If the value is odd, it returns "True." Otherwise, it returns "False."

ISTEXT( value )
Checks whether a value is text

JOIN( range , [ delimiter ])
Combines a range of cells into a string with optional delimiters between the values

LARGE( range , n )
Returns the n-th highest number in a provided range

LEFT( text , [ num_chars ])
Returns the leftmost characters from a text string

LEN( text )
Returns the number of characters in a text string, including spaces

LOWER( text )
Converts any uppercase characters to lowercase

MATCH ( search_value , range , [ search_type ])
Returns the relative position of a value in a range (lookup table). The first position is 1.

MAX( value1 , [ value2, ... ])
Returns the highest number or latest date.

MEDIAN( number1 , [ number2, ... ])
Returns the value of the midpoint of the range of numbers

MID( text , start_position , num_chars )
Returns a portion of text based on a given starting point and number of characters

MIN( value1 , [ value2, ... ])
Returns the lowest number or earliest date

MOD( dividend , divisor )
Returns the remainder after a division operation

MONTH( date )
Returns a number representing the number of the month, 1-12, where 1 is January

MROUND( number , [ multiple ])
Returns a number rounded up to the desired multiple

NETDAYS( start_date , end_date )
Returns the number of days from a start date to an end date

NETWORKDAY( start_date , end_date , [ holidays ])
Returns the number of working days between two dates. Adds 1 day to the result if the start date is a non-working day.

NETWORKDAYS( start_date , end_date , [ holidays ])
Returns the number of working days between two dates.

NOT( logical_expression )
Used within another function to provide the opposite of a logical expression

NPV( discount_rate , number , range1 , [ range2, ... ])
Calculates the net present value of an investment based on a series of cash flows and a discount rate

OR( logical_expression1 , [ logical_expression2 ])
Used within another function to return true if at least one provided logical expression is true.

PARENT([ reference ])
References the parent of the specified cell.

PERCENTILE( range , percentile )
Returns the value of a given percentile in a range

PRORATE( number , start_date , end_date , prorate_start , prorate_end , [ decimal_places ])
Returns a portion of a value divided across a provided date range

RANKAVG( number , range , [ order ])
Returns the rank of a number relative to other numbers in a range, and assigns an average rank to any duplicates.

RANKEQ( number , range , [ order ])
Returns the rank of a number relative to other numbers in a range

REPLACE( text , start_position , num_chars , new_text )
Replaces a string of characters, starting at a given position and ending a given number of characters beyond

RIGHT( text , start_position , num_chars , new_text )
Returns the rightmost characters from a text string

ROUND( number , [ decimal_places ])
Rounds a given number to the desired number of decimal places

ROUNDDOWN( number , [ decimal ])
Rounds a number down to a specified number of decimal places

ROUNDUP( number , [ decimal ])
Rounds a number up to a specified number of decimal places

SMALL( range , n )
Returns the n-th lowest number in a provided range

STDEVA( range1 , [ range2, ... ])
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample set of values

STDEVP( range1 , [ range2, ... ])
Estimates standard deviation based on a set of values, including non-numbers

STDEVPA( range1 , [ range2, ... ])
Calculates standard deviation based on an entire set of values, including non-numbers

STDEVS( range1 , [ range2, ... ])
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample population of numbers, ignoring non-numbers

SUBSTITUTE( search_text , old_text , new_text , [ replace_num ])
Replaces existing text with new text in a string

SUCCESSORS( value )
Used within another function to calculate the direct successors of a task and return succeeding task row number(s) that occur as a result of the referenced task.

SUM( number1 , [ number2, ... ])
Adds a series of numbers

SUMIF( range , criterion , [ sum_range ])
Adds numbers within a range that meet a specified condition

SUMIFS( range , criterion_range1 , criterion1 , [ criterion_range2 , criterion2, ... ])
Adds numbers within a range when all given conditions in their respective ranges are met.

TODAY([ number ])
Used in a Date column to return the current date

TOTALFLOAT( value )
Calculates the number of days that a task can be delayed without impacting the Project Finish Date.

UNICHAR( text )
Converts a number into a Unicode character.

UPPER( text )
Converts lowercase characters in a text string to uppercase

VALUE( text )
Converts a text value that represents a number into a number

VLOOKUP( search_value , lookup_table , column_num , [ match_type ])
Looks up a value and returns a corresponding value in the same row but from a different column.

WEEKDAY( date )
Returns a number representing the day of the week, 1-7, where Sunday equals 1

WEEKNUMBER( date )
Returns a number representing the week of the year, 1-53, where 1 is the first week in the year.

WORKDAY( date , num_days , [ holidays ])
Used in a Date column to return a date from a specified number of working days.

YEAR( date )
Returns the year from a date as a four-digit number

YEARDAY( date )
Returns a number representing the day in the year, 1-365, where 1 is the first day of the year
